snippet: A federal three-judge panel in San Antonio ruled Thursday that the state’s long-delayed primary election would be held on May 29, with a runoff on July 31.
abstract: Federal three-judge panel in San Antonio rules that the state's long-delayed primary election will be held on May 29, 2012; judges had twice pushed back the primary because of a redistricting dispute.
lead_paragraph: A federal three-judge panel in San Antonio ruled Thursday that the state’s long-delayed primary election would be held on May 29, with a runoff on July 31.

headline.main: Texas: Primary Election Set for May 29
headline.print_headline: Texas: Primary Election Set For May 29
